titlestmt.titleproper: Ford Foundation records, International Division, Latin America and the Caribbean, Office Files of Peter A. Fraenkel
A Guide to the Ford Foundation records, International Division, Latin America and the Caribbean, Office Files of Peter A. Fraenkel FA615

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-02-01 01:10:20 -0500.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Ford Foundation records, International Division, Latin America and the Caribbean, Office Files of Peter A. Fraenkel

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimal Processing has been conducted to establish basic intellectual and physical control of the material and assess immediate preservation and conservation needs. Material remains as received, in original folders and storage boxes.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged in 3 series by file type. Further arrangement is loosely alphabetical.
Series II. Educational Modernization Grant, Madrid Field Office Files, 1969-1973

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains subject files, correspondence, trip files, reports, documentation of grants including the educational modernization grant, field office materials and a small selection of photographs.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Through his various positions at Indiana University Bloomington and the Ford Foundation, Peter Fraenkel (1923-2007) established a long career focused on higher education and educational reform. Fraenkel joined the Ford Foundation in 1962 as a Program Advisor in the Latin America Program. For several years, he served as the Foundation's Representative to Peru before moving to the Division of Education and Research where he worked as Assistant to the Vice President. Fraenkel spent his last years at the Foundation as a Program Advisor in the Division of Education and Research, Public Education Program. He was based in Madrid, Spain and directed a project focused on modernizing and improving education in Spain.

Fraenkel served in the Indiana University Bloomington's President's Office both before and after his time at the Ford Foundation. After leaving the Foundation in 1974, he returned to the university and continued his work in Spain as a consultant to the Spanish Minister of Education and Science. This work was funded by a Ford Foundation grant. In 1978, Fraenkel was appointed Assistant to the President at IU. His last position at the university was in the Office of International Programs as Director of Overseas Projects Development.

Fraenkel completed his undergraduate education in 1946 at Indiana University Bloomington where he majored in physics and mathematics. Born in Germany in 1923, he and his family moved to Bolivia in order to escape Nazi persecution. Prior to working at Indiana University, he served as an educational advisor for the American Military Government in Germany after World War II in 1947. Fraenkel died in 2007 after a battle with Alzheimer's disease.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Ford Foundation has title, copyright and literary rights in the collection, in so far as it holds them.

The Rockefeller Archive Center has authority to grant permission to cite and publish material from the collection. Permission to publish extensive excerpts, or material in its entirety, will be referred to the Ford Foundation.
